clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Levothyroxine on Endothelial Function of Patients With Subclinical Hypothyroidism
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Levothyroxine on Endothelial Function of Patients With Subclinical Hypothyroidism

brief_summary.textblock: Hypothyroidism is risk factor in atherosclerotic cardiovascular diseases, but there is a controversy in effect of subclinical hypothyroidism on cardiovascular diseases. We aim to estimate the relation between subclinical hypothyroidism and endothelial dysfunction and the effects of levothyroxine therapy on it. Patients with confirmed subclinical hypothyroidism by lab results will be randomized to two groups of treatment with one daily dose of 100 mg Levothyroxine or placebo. The flow-mediated dilation and intima media thickness are evaluated before and after the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline flow-mediated dilation at 2 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and then 2 months after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Flow-mediated dilation will be assessed using standard method with a radiologist unaware to the study arms at baseline and then 2 months after treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline intima-media thickness at 2 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and then 2 months after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Intima-media thickness will be assessed using standard method with a radiologist unaware to the study arms at baseline and then 2 months after treatment.

arm_group.description: In the treatment group, daily doses of 100 mg of Levothyroxine will be administered every morning, half an hour before breakfast.
In the placebo group treatment regimen and advices are identical to that of the treatment group, except for using a pharmacologically neutral agent, with complete resemblance to the real treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18 to 65
- confirmed subclinical hypothyroidism
Exclusion Criteria:
- receiving of other treatments for hypothyroidism
- patients with other major medical disorders
- smoking
- hyperlipidemia
- obesity
